ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ أَلْهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Fierce competition for this world distracted you
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: THE AVARICE OF plenitude keeps you occupied
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: The craving for ever-greater worldly gains and to excel others in that regard keeps you occupied
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: The desire to have more of the worldly gains have pre-occupied you so much (that you have neglected remembring God),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The craving for excess wealth kept you people neglectful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Rivalry in worldly increase distracteth you
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Greed for more and more distracted you [from God]
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: The emulous desire of abundance engrosseth you,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: The mutual rivalry for piling up (the good things of this world) diverts you (from the more serious things),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: The mutual rivalry for piling up of worldly things diverts you,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: The excessive gathering (of increase and boasting) occupied you (from worshipping and obeying)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [102:1] Rivalry [in worldly things], mutual vainglory about wealth, children and men, distracts you, preoccupies you [diverting you] from obedience to God,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said about the interpretation of Allah's saying (Rivalry in worldly increase distracteth you): '(Rivalry in worldly increase distracteth you) He says: bragging about your status and lineage has distracted you
